title: 'Should I strip the paint off my walls to reveal the brickwork underneath?'
text:
Every week, the Telegraph’s Property Doctors bring expertise on renovations and DIY, interiors, buying and selling, lettings, legal issues and taxes – addressing three topics. Send your questions to propertydoctors@telegraph.co.uk

Renovations and DIY

Q At the back of my Seventies bungalow is an L-shaped area. It is a bit of a sun trap and the previous owners have covered the beautiful brickwork with pale yellow paint, presumably to reflect the sunlight and heat.

It appears to be water-based exterior paint. Is there any way to remove this and return it back to the natural brick finish without compromising the weatherproofing surface of the bricks and their appearance? I estimate there is...
description: Every week, the Telegraph’s Property Doctors bring expertise on renovations and DIY, interiors, buying and selling, lettings, legal issues and taxes – addressing three topics.
